resources.string: Adjective (a.)\u00A0: \n1. a word that expresses an attribute of something \n2. the word class that qualifies nouns
Adverb (adv.)\u00A0: \n1. the word class that qualifies verbs or clauses \n2. a word that modifies something other than a noun

Conjunction (conj.)\u00A0: \n1. an uninflected function word that serves to conjoin words, phrases, clauses or sentences \n2. the grammatical relation between linguistic units (words, phrases or clauses) that are connected by a conjunction
Definitive (def.)\u00A0: \na determiner (as \'the\' in English) that indicates specificity of reference
Exclamation (excl.)\u00A0: \n1. an abrupt excited utterance \n2. a loud complaint, protest or reproach
Indefinite Pronoun (pron. indef.)\u00A0: \nrefers to non-specific beings, objects, or places
Interjection (int.)\u00A0: \nan informal farewell remark
Interrogative Pronoun (int. pron.)\u00A0: \na function word used to ask a question, such as what, when, where, who, why and how

Interrogative Adverb (inter. adv.)\u00A0: \na type of function word or expression that stands in for (expresses the same content as) another word, phrase clause or sentence where the meaning is recoverable from the context
Intransitive Verb (v.i.)\u00A0: \na verb that does not require or cannot take a direct object
Literal Noun (l.n.)\u00A0: \nlimited to the explicit meaning of a word

Noun (n.) : \n1. a content word that can be used to refer to a person, place, thing, quality, or action \n2. the word class that can serve as the subject or object of a verb, the object of a preposition, or in apposition
Nominal Prefix (nom.) : \nadded to the front of a word, a phrase that can function as the subject or object of a verb
Numeric (num.) : \n1. of or relating to or denoting numbers \n2. measured or expressed in numbers
Particle (part.)\u00A0: \na function word that can be used in English to form phrasal verbs
Passive (pass.)\u00A0: \nexpressing that the subject of the sentence is the patient of the action denoted by the verb
Personal Pronoun (pers. pron.)\u00A0: \nindicating grammatical person
Plural (pl.)\u00A0: \n1. composed of more than one member, set, or king \n2. grammatical number category referring to two or more items or units
Possessive Particle (poss. part.)\u00A0: \nserving to express or indicate possession
Possessive Particle, Plural (poss. part. pl.)\u00A0: \n(see above, plural)
Prefix (pref.)\u00A0: \nan affix that is added in front of a word

Preposition (prep.)\u00A0: \n1. a function word that combines with a noun or pronoun or noun phrase to form a prepositional phrase that can have an adverbial relation to some other word \n2. the placing of one linguistic element before another (as placing a modifier before a word it modifies in a sentence or placing an affix before the base to which it is attached
Pronoun (pron.)\u00A0: \na function word that is used in place of a noun or noun phrase
Relative Pronoun (rel. pron.)\u00A0: \na pronoun (as \'that\' or \'which\' or \'who\') that introduces a relative clause referring to some antecedent
Second Person Singular (art.)\u00A0: \npronouns and verbs used to refer to the person addressed by the language in which they occur
Second Person Plural (art. pl.)\u00A0: \n
Single Possessive Particle (sgl.pos.part.)\u00A0: \n
Single Possessive Pronoun (sgl.pos.pron.)\u00A0: \n
Suffix (suff.)\u00A0: \nan affix that is added at the end of the word
Verb (v.)\u00A0: \n1. the word class that serves as the predicate of a sentence \n2. a content word that denotes an action, occurrence, or state of existence
Transitive Verb (v.t.)\u00A0: \na verb that requires a direct object to complete the meaning
